author: sproul
content:
Probably a question that has already been asnwered, if so, I apologise. Why does the spec _always_ do verification of the block hash & versioned hashes in `verify_and_notify_new_payload` when the expectation is that this will be done by the EL? In Lighthouse we are currently only doing this verification when we're doing long-range sync and skipping sending `newPayload`.

<https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/v1.4.0-beta.2/specs/deneb/beacon-chain.md#modified-process_execution_payload>

author: karalabe
content:
Re blob experiments above:

> Works as intended 
> Whether that's good or bad is debatable
> Even if all the blob pool implementations were exactly the same, you could still clear out the blobs easily by submitting a sweep tx to MEV builders
> If this becomes an issue, we can further lower the max number of blob txs a single account can send
> At the most agressive, you can have 1 blob tx total, then a sweep would clear out 1 blob tx, jsut the ux drops significantly

author: karalabe
content: Geth is currently capping accounts to 16 blob txs, independent of size. This means 6 blob txs can 6x the "damange" vs 1 blob txs. We could also make the 16 cap be for total blob count, not tx count, but it gets a bit more complex. I'd wait out what happens and reevaluate based on that

author: marcinds
content: In Nethermind we do the same - 16 txs per sender, no matter about number of blobs

author: holiman
content: Geth also does not allow gapped blob-transactions: no `queued`, only `pending`.

author: marcinds
content: Yeah, we do the same. Only up to 16 consecutive nonces
